intro: Ruellia haenkeana, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, tubular blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shady areas. Ruellia haenkeana is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
